author: seatiki

author: biiazso18
title: Not a social network
content:
WhatsApp was first and foremost built to be a cross-platform messaging app. It's classic, easy to use and not overly complicated and THAT's the reason it's so popular, the reason people use it.
 I try to understand Facebook bringing their Snapchat story clone into every single app they own, but WhatsApp isn't like FB or Instagram. People use it to chat with friends and family, either one-on-one or in group chats. It doesn't belong here and most certainly isn't worth taking 2 actually convenient tabs away for Status and Camera, which could very well be put together into one. 
The thing about Status is that absolutely no one uses it because there's already so many out there doing the same that were BUILT to do it. WhatsApp isn't. I give it two stars because at least they made a U-turn on text statuses, now just get rid of the 24-hour feature. 
You put out good updates bringing good additions in the past, video calling just to name one. This isn't people rejecting change, it's people knowing the heart of WhatsApp and what it does best, the reason it's sitting at the top. They don't want yet another social network (especially not in a messaging app) doing the exact same thing. And the reason I among my many friends keep using it is to stay in touch, not to view each other's stories. 
Despite the horrible and unneccessary update, I am grateful for the messaging part of the app and the way it functions. Please focus on that.

author: Applefella
title: No user names!
content: The idea of not having user names and associating your identity with your phone number was a brilliant, almost genius one which I guess required a lot of cool engineering in the backend. I think that's why Whatsapp's user base is the ginormous number of users that it is today. The ability to set privacy preferences was good. Photo & video sharing, audio calling, video calling which came later kept it a compelling application. Cool features like a desktop version of the application makes it nice to use. Automated chat backups on iCloud make it very useful. Secure messaging is welcome. Group messaging is awesome but was confusing earlier when the ability to reply to individual messages was not there. It can still be annoying when you get added to groups without your permission. Default auto-download settings should be 'off'. I hope stickers are on the way soon. Ability to view timeline of chat history and scroll to a particular point in time is sorely missing. A minor feature that would be welcome would be the ability to search individual chat histories. The application did go back to weird state a couple of times for me recently and it kept my chat history but lost all my settings which was very annoying. The new 24 hour status feature which I hear is copied seems useless.

title: Camera takes fuzzy photos every time
content:
WhatsApp in general is fine. But every photo I take in the app is fuzzy; and more zoomed in than my normal photos app. It‚Äôs like they are putting camera in video mode and taking a screenshot. I guess this is part of their cross platform library but still, I wish it would let the camera app use more native and high quality functionality.

Additionally, it‚Äôs wayyy too easy to send things to the wrong person. You can‚Äôt remove people from ‚Äúrecently contacted‚Äù or ‚Äúfrequently contacted‚Äù prompts around iOS for sharing. I‚Äôm terrified I will send my girlfriends brother something immodest because his name shows above hers even though our chat volumes are way different.

WhatsApp is a globally loved tool but has some pretty strange UX issues given its financial backer and experienced staff. I will continue to use it as most of the world doesn‚Äôt have iMessage; but if they did; I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôd miss the WhatsApp app that much.

author: Ao1311:)$
title: Very very good
content: I never ever write reviews because who has time for them. But I've started to use WhatsApp a few months ago to talk to family and friends in a different country and it's amazing. In fact almost all of my friends (high school) and cousins and older family members use WhatsApp to talk to one another. It's free and there is no dumb "well the app is free but you have to pay for extra stuff" it's COMPLETELY FREE. I'm able to see when the text delivered, when the other person saw it and if it's a voice message then when they listened to it. You can also replay voice messages. You can also do stories on it like snapchat which is kinda cool. Over all it's really great, it doesn't have glitches and it isn't slow. I 100% would recommend

author: Ninjamaze
title: Messages screen jumps back randomly to older msgs
content: I've just recently been having a recurring and somewhat annoying experience with this app. After opening a chat to read new messages, the screen will randomly jump back to messages posted earlier in the chat. During these times I'm doing nothing other than reading new messages; nothing is in contact with the screen. Sometimes this will also happen when I'm typing a reply; the previous msgs window will jump up to earlier msgs. I know it's not my screen being over sensitive b/c this doesn't happen with any other app. Love the app but recently noticed this. Hoping by leaving a review this small glitch will be made apparent and resolved.

author: Sz_7
title: A few suggestions
content:
- Can you please remove "Tap here for contact info" line that appears below the contact name/number? It just delays the online status of the contact. Removing it will let us check online status of contacts faster.
- Adding a symbol beside/on the profile picture of the contact to indicate they are currently online (like that green circle in Facebook Messenger) is definitely worth adding.
- Instead of selecting a picture and then tapping "add" then select multiple pictures, why isn't there a multiple picture mode in the first place? A "select mode" available from the start once I decide to share media would make the process much more convenient. 
- Please add an option for "tap to record" voice notes instead of hold to record.

This is a win-win-win situation!!

author: 3fJxt1Ga
title: 3FJXT1GA
content:
Parents need to know that WhatsApp Messenger lets users start video calls and send encrypted text messages, videos, photos, and audio messages to one or many people with no message limits or fees until after the first year of use, when there's a $0.99 annual fee. The catch is these messages can only be sent to other smartphone users who also have WhatsApp. Once you install the app, it checks your address book to see if anyone else you know is already using WhatsApp and connects you automatically. The app also suggests allowing messages to be sent from your phone to those in your address book who aren't yet using WhatsApp, encouraging them to sign up. WhatsApp's license agreement requires users to be age 16 or older. In terms of questionable content, it's completely up to the user, but location-sharing capabilities make this app most appropriate for older teens. As of 2016 WhatsApp shares data with parent company Facebook; though users can opt out of some of the data sharing for a limited time, they can't completely opt out. Read the app's privacy policy to find out more about the types of information collected and shared.

author: jam9999
title: Bloated app...
content: WhatsApp has decent core chat capability but suffers from continued feature bloat and the inability to disable functionality that users don't want. For example, it would be great to disable WhatsApp calling entirely. It's way too easy to accidentally dial someone. I also don't want people WhatsApp calling me when I'm not on wifi. Yes, I can just not take the call, but a smarter, more user-friendly feature would be preferred. The status tab was also a mistake that, as of yet, the developers refuse to unwind. Not a single contact of mine uses it. It's not what chat apps are for. Better muting of notifications would also be good. If I mute a thread, I want nothing at all from it till the mute expires: no notifications, no badge icons, no unarchiving. Finally, the periodic verification requests for two-step authentication are annoying and inconsistent with my expectations for how the feature should work and with the way I've seen any other app implement this. They're so annoying, that they could encourage users to turn the feature off, which would be counter to the intent of the feature.

author: b_aslam
title: A Great App, but not Perfect
content:
I love this app, I really do. It's got features ahead of its time, and I'm a huge fan of the end to end encryption! However, I do think some improvements could be made. A search function in chats, improvements to audio and video calls, and lastly the ability to set individual chat wallpapers. 

This app however is great, it's zipping fast. It hasn't crashed on me. Another great thing is using whatsapp on the web, the only downside to that is that your phone just be on and connected to the internet. So if you lose your phone for example or the battery dies, you still can't see any messages from whatsapp.

author: Seyss
title: Missing tons of features!
content:
- No self-destruct messages.
- Can't save more than 5 photos/videos at once to Camera Roll.
- Can't disable group/voice read receipts.
- App freezes/stutters while downloading lots of media.
- Video being played is interrupted once a background download finishes. VERY ANNOYING!!
- Even after clearing up all chats, app still keeps lots of undeletable stuck data.
- Can't clear all media and keep only text chats (no granular "clear all chats").
- No iPad / Apple Watch / iMessage support.
- Can't backup only text to iCloud (no granular backup).
- Swipe for media gallery shortcut removed.
- Archived messages confusing implementation.
- No background send from other apps (have to wait for the progress bar to complete).
- Can't search inside individual chats.
- Confusing "all starred chats" UI inside settings: make it like a regular group so we can have all the group features (mass share/save/select-all, etc).
- If you move your finger while voice recording, you can lose all you already recorded, which is terrible for long messages.
- No option to demote admins if you are the group creator.
- Messages that failed to be downloaded have to be redownloaded one by one (Whatsapp should automatically retry downloading all failed messages until they are downloaded).
- Non-admins can change group icon/name.
- Web interface and Desktop app depends on phone connection/battery to work (no direct access to Whatsapp's servers).
- While viewing all media, can't filter for video/photo/audio.
- Can't make regular calls from Whatsapp itself.
- No drafts like Telegram.
- No music player.
- No native Live Photos send support (stupidly converts it to a gif instead).
- Clumsy and slow camera UI that crops your photo and takes no Live Photos.
- Can't filter data usage by cellular/wifi.
- UI for sending live photos as gif/vid and UI for filters are very hidden!

4. Blocked contacts should be removed from the contact list and placed in a separate list.
5. Frequent contacts should have their own list.

title: Still a great update but bring back the old status!
content: The new update is great, I am sure it has been a big project. Only shows whatsapp is always improving things. BUT, a lot of people (including myself) use the old text status. There should be a way of it coexisting with the latest feature. Or why should status only last a day? Why not make it an option - so people who likes the old status can write their status like before and it stays there for how long as they want. Also, whatsapp has all my contacts - my family, coworkers, friends from school, friends from work, drinking buddies. Current privacy settings are not enough to handle these. There should be a way to set privacy settings to groups. Instead of fiddling around with contacts one by one every time you put up a status! Still a great app but the new feature opened it up to issues. Hope they will be able to address these in future updates.

author: COWayfair
title: Perfectly intuitive and utilitarian
content: Whatsapp is a perfectly functional chat for managing conversations with friends and family across multiple geographies, operating systems, and carriers. We find it particularly helpful when traveling with a group to keep everyone apprised of where we are going. And throwing out a pin of your location has saved us on more than one occasion when we didn't speak the local language that well. We find it also helpful to have a chat for the pet sitter so we can see photo and video updates of the animals while we are gone. And finally, because whatsapp is so easy to use, we can even use it with my parents. Been using WhatsApp for years and can't think of a reason I would ever stop.

title: Some issues, plus a glitch on this recent update
content:
Firstly, a reviewer mentioned about the fact that a person not registered in your contact has the full name appearing only on the lock screen, YES, this is true! Why doesn't the name appear when you look at the persons info? 

Second, on this update there seems to be a glitch with voice messages. If I sent a voice message that was 3:29 long, and then I send another one to the same person that was 0:07 long, it appears as if the voice message is the same length as the longest one I sent that day, which would be 3:29. How does this affect data usage?? 

Third, there must be a way to send messages to someone without having to add the number into my phone's contact list. I'm looking for an apartment and they're all reachable through WhatsApp, but why would I need their number on a long term basis?? It's just cluttering up my phone with numbers I won't use ever again.

I previously used Voxer frequently as a walkie talkie. My family enjoys using your microphone feature as such. If you could make the microphone easier to grab hold of (it is easy to lose hold of it), and perhaps a tap to talk, tap to stop feature instead? Great app!!

ETA: Still one of my favorite apps, but myself and several of my family members all have the same request. On Apple phones, using the "talk" feature is a challenge. It is hard to grab and even harder to keep your finger on when you're talking. A "tap to talk" option would be so much better than having to hold it the entire time to talk. Please, designers, I hope you're reading this. That one feature would make this the best app in the store!!

author: SirMegatron
title: Whatsapp saved the day during hurricane Irma
content:
I've never been so eager to tell and write a review about how great the WhatsApp application was after hurricane Irma hit Miami. 

Even though I could not make phone calls or send regular text messages with my iPhone7s for long periods of hours - WhatsApp was able to send text messages without cellular data service or an available internet connection!

I totally underestimated the power of WhatsApp. This powerful communication tool was there when everything else failed. It brought light and hope when we were cut off from the outside world.

I have a tiny suggestion that I've always wanted to have while using the app- I want to be able to change each contact's name color on a group. I find it irritating having random colors for everyone, and while you get used to it, it'll change it randomly again the next update. 
But overall- this app is great and I use it all the time.

Really annoying just to send a random one time or short lived text with someone like when trying to coordinate meeting up to buy or sell something. 
Also annoying that I can only see a persons name (if not in my contacts) in the lock screen notification. Once I open the message I can only see the phone number and contact picture. The organization of this app is terrible. Hopefully Facebook can dedicate some real app designers and developers to overhaul this app. As of now this app is lacking in a lot of ways.

The app was perfect for just that communicating but it seems to have gotten confused on what it's goal is? (The chats button is not even in the middle anymore, a camera is. My contact favorites are no longer a part of the menu either). I did not download and create a whatsapp account to have a different type of snapchat. It should re-focus its priorities as a text and call app.

Until today morning it was great communication application. Today it updated and instead of my Favorites I may want to talk to I have funny useless circle wich bumps me in nearly empty Status page. Nothing useful there - except it links me to my camera. There is camera button for that - and there is nothing pretty around I would want to even send to anyone. 
It seems that the attempt is to move the Whatsapp from the function I got and use it (=communication with friends and family) to something else. DO NOT DO IT. I really do not want to, yet again, force everyone to yet another application in which we can communicate without much ovehead. I moved everyone from Skype to Whatsapp some time ago when they screwed up Skype. Now Whatsapp? Can we just keep the good things?

author: M. Jilani
title: Mr. M. Jilani. Sgt. Retired; Miami Dade County.
content: It has been very exciting to have this App. and I certainly appreciate it very much. It has been a blessing for 100s & Millions of people who could not afford to call or see their friend & loved ones. I have a question about some notifications that appear to ask patrons to forward certain message come from App. Administration suggesting App. Users to forward the message to at least 5, 10 or 15 people to earn qualification to use WhatsApp free. In the past I never believed the messages were authentic & never followed the instruction, and I never had any issues with WhatsApp using it. Please let us know if the messages are sent by someone claiming to be the Director or some high official of WhatsApp. I'm so thankful and appreciative of your WhatsApp & don't remember any technical difficulties that I remember ! The only thing I noticed is losing WhatsApp call when a regular is incoming & WhatsApp call gets disconnected due to no Call waiting Intimation. But that's ok, it's a free call. Thank you all. Sincerely, M. Jilani

author: jam9999
title: Bloated app...
content: WhatsApp has decent core chat capability but suffers from continued feature bloat and the inability to disable functionality that users don't want. For example, it would be great to disable WhatsApp calling entirely. The status tab was also a mistake that, as of yet, the developers refuse to unwind. Not a single contact of mine uses it. It's not what chat apps are for. Better muting of notifications would also be good. If I mute a thread, I want nothing at all from it till the mute expires: no notifications, no badge icons, no unarchiving. Finally, the periodic verification requests for two-step authentication are annoying and inconsistent with my expectations for how the feature should work and with the way I've seen any other app implement this. They're so annoying, that they could encourage users to turn the feature off, which would be counter to the intent of the feature.

author: upnorth85
title: Spam enabler, no privacy protection
content: I used this App for several months. It is good for connecting with international folks, for forming family chat groups etc. Some of the shortcomings, unlike linked-in or Facebook, where you can decline an invite, anyone who has your cell number, can using what's app add you to a group chat-without your permission. What's App goes through your contact list and puts a what's app usage indicator for anyone in your contact list and does this likewise on other people's phone. When groups get large enormous files get downloaded through videos. From being a great way to use for business, it became a total waste of my productive time. This is an ideal app for retired people or those not working full time. It is an ideal app for social loafing. I would like to see what's app give more control to user and privacy is non existent. You cannot use what's app without sharing your contact list with what's app. I never have my cell number to Facebook. What's App owned by Facebook, had transferred my cell number to my Facebook account. Parents should be particularly careful to avoid their kids meeting dangerous adults amen bad intentions through chat sessions.

I just really miss having the favourites tab that showed my contacts and their statuses. So if you could bring that back it would be great.

author: _Mav
title: A bloated mess
content:
Each update adds a new button, changes the layout of others, makes the app look and feel more and more bloated. This app is far from streamlined/simple if you're new to it. 

The biggest mistake by far is "WhatsApp status" ‚Äì I mean, what a joke. It's such an obvious cheap copy and removed one other great feature, the favorites-list where you could view all text-statuses at a glance. Good old times‚Ä¶

I hope the devs of this app will soon develop it to death, until no one is able to shoot a quick message without accidentally uploading a status/calling someone/opening up the camera any more. This way we're hopefully getting a better alternative ‚Äì from a company that's not Facebook.

author: Ibby11
title: Thank you!
content: On behalf of my neighbors and me, I would like to sincerely thank the WhatsApp crew for a quality service that helped us help our flooded neighbors after Hurricane Harvey! WhatsApp worked when all other forms of contact would not work after the hurricane. We were able to create groups to communicate dire information quickly, efficiently, and without interruption. This allowed us to rescue neighbors, get medical help from neighbors who are part of the medical community when 911 was not working, and then organize volunteer work crews to start checking in on elderly neighbors and finally create volunteer remediation crews. WhatsApp, you are exemplary! Thank you, thank you! Elizabeth SW Houston Texas

author: Anonymous User 23579
title: OK but better options exist
content:
Whatsapp is a pretty good messaging app. I like that many people use it. I love the fact that they added end to end encryption (a must to keep communications private between users).  It generally runs well.

What I don't like about Whatsapp is that it requires my phone number to register. A mobile phone number is almost always directly linked to one's identity and can potentially be used to find your name, address, and other personal info. It would be better if Whatsapp allowed registering by picking a username and password with email optional for password recovery.

I also don't like that for the app to work well, it needs access to my contacts info. My contacts info is private to me and my contacts. If Whatsapp used usernames instead of phone numbers, access to my contacts info would not be needed.

It's obvious that Whatsapp wants to know the identities of their users and their social circle (who they know and who they communicate with).  The terms of service even allow Whatsapp to share your personal information, like your phone number, with its parent company, Facebook, presumably for marketing and advertising purposes.

Another thing I don't like about Whatsapp is that it's not open source.  The programming code is closed source so programmers cannot independently check the code to ensure there are no backdoors or ways to spy on users' communications. It would be better for users if Whatsapp was 100% open source.

The only free, full-featured messaging and calling app that I'm aware of that is 100% open source, has end to end encryption at all times, does not require a phone number to register (must go to their website from a computer and click "open in web"), and does not require access to any contacts info, is Wire Private Messenger.  Wire's privacy policy and terms of use also doesn't share any of your information with other parties. Signal is a decent option if you don't mind giving your phone number and access to contacts info, which are required. Chatsecure is open source, end to end encrypted, doesn't require phone number or contacts access, but is more of a chat/instant messaging app rather than a full-featured calling and messaging app.  Hope this review was helpful to at least some folks out there. Good luck!

author: RDKXX
title: Disappointing Support
content:
No one needs to be told how important Whatsapp has been for day-to-day communication. After being so successful even after being brought by Facebook.. it's kinda surprising to find out that support for this widely popular app is abysmal.

My iPhone 6 installed Whatsapp crashed exactly after the June 5,2017 update. I'd followed their instructions on their Website's FAQs and send the crash reports via email. I did and all the response I got till date was an automated email ask me to change the chat wallpaper for some reason. 

The June 15, 2017-Update just got out.. 
I updated the app hoping they might have fixed the crash bug, but guess what?! Absolutely nothing! What's so disappointing is no one has even bothered to reach out. 

How can we trust such applications if they don't provide the needed support?

author: Seyss
title: Missing tons of features!
content:
- No self-destruct messages.
- Can't save more than 5 photos/videos at once to Camera Roll.
- Can't disable group/voice read receipts.
- App freezes/stutters while downloading lots of media.
- Video being played is interrupted once a background download finishes. VERY ANNOYING!!
- Even after clearing up all chats, app still keeps lots of undeletable stuck data.
- Can't clear all media and keep only text chats (no granular "clear all chats").
- No iPad / Apple Watch / iMessage support.
- Can't backup only text to iCloud (no granular backup).
- Swipe for media gallery shortcut removed.
- Archived messages confusing implementation.
- No background send from other apps (have to wait for the progress bar to complete).
- Can't search inside individual chats.
- Confusing "all starred chats" UI inside settings: make it like a regular group so we can have all the group features (mass share/save/select-all, etc).
- If you move your finger while voice recording, you can lose all you already recorded, which is terrible for long messages.
- No option to demote admins if you are the group creator.
- Messages that failed to be downloaded have to be redownloaded one by one (Whatsapp should automatically retry downloading all failed messages until they are downloaded).
- Non-admins can change group icon/name.
- Web interface and Desktop app depends on phone connection/battery to work (no direct access to Whatsapp's servers).
- While viewing all media, can't filter for video/photo/audio.
- Can't make regular calls from Whatsapp itself.
- No drafts like Telegram.
- No music player.
- No native Live Photos send support (stupidly converts it to a gif instead).
- Clumsy and slow camera UI that crops your photo and takes no Live Photos.
- Can't filter data usage by cellular/wifi.

author: Jme-omr
title: Remove the camera icon bring back contacts!
content:

author: AJ-allovertheglobe
title: 5 thumbs up and 2 thumbs down
content:
Initially this review was going to be five thumbs up and one thumb down, but after taking time to write a well thought out review, when I pressed send, you informed me that the nickname I had chosen was already in use and deleted my carefully written set of comments. So based on that, I am downgrading you to two thumbs down.

Now to the good. This is a wonderful app, especially when traveling overseas. It allows me, when I'm outside of my home telephone free area, to communicate easily and do so virtually cost free.

When I travel overseas, I often travel with two phones: one with my home country SIM card in it and my other phone, with the temporarily purchased SIM card of the country I am visiting. What is particularly aggravating, is that upon returning home and going back to using my regular home phone, WhatsApp, even though I was using the same account while traveling, does not pull my overseas conversations back onto my home phone. That leaves huge holes and discontinuities in important to remember conversations. It's a fault WhatsApp app needs to work on.

author: Seyss
title: Missing tons of features!
content:
- No self-destruct messages.
- Can't save more than 5 photos/videos at once to Camera Roll.
- Can't disable group/voice read receipts.
- App freezes/stutters while downloading lots of media.
- Video being played is interrupted once a background download finishes. VERY ANNOYING!!
- Even after clearing up all chats, app still keeps lots of undeletable stuck data.
- Can't clear all media and keep only text chats (no granular "clear all chats").
- No iPad / Apple Watch / iMessage support.
- Can't backup only text to iCloud (no granular backup).
- Swipe for media gallery shortcut removed.
- Archived messages confusing implementation.
- No background send from other apps (have to wait for the progress bar to complete).
- Can't search inside individual chats.
- Confusing "all starred chats" UI inside settings: make it like a regular group so we can have all the group features (mass share/save/select-all, etc).
- If you move your finger while voice recording, you can lose all you already recorded, which is terrible for long messages.
- No option to demote admins if you are the group creator.
- Messages that failed to be downloaded have to be redownloaded one by one (Whatsapp should automatically retry downloading all failed messages until they are downloaded).
- Non-admins can change group icon/name.
- Web interface and Desktop app depends on phone connection/battery to work (no direct access to Whatsapp's servers).
- While viewing all media, can't filter for video/photo/audio.
- Can't make regular calls from Whatsapp itself.
- No drafts like Telegram.
- No music player.
- No native Live Photos send support (stupidly converts it to a gif instead).
- Clumsy and slow camera UI that crops your photo and takes no Live Photos.
- Can't filter data usage by cellular/wifi.

author: Jediforce70
title: Great App, Just a Suggestion to Improve User Friendliness
content:
Great app. An app you can reliably count on without crashing is important.

I've been using whatsapp for a while now, recently it has been taking over standard messaging with more and more people being connected through data.

However, as more and more people use this app, the more chats and groups you will have. Very quickly you will find yourself endlessly scrolling your chats to just to find the group you want or the contact you want. Sometimes, group pictures alone is not enough to stand out and make you quickly find the chat you are looking for. It's just not quick enough.

So why not give us the flexibility to quickly group our chats and groups into folders? All my work-related chats, hobby-related chats, and family-related chats will all be in folders at the top, ready at a glance. Won't that be nice?

Suddenly whatsapp would be instantly faster. Not only will you be able to quickly access ALL the groups you frequently talk to, but also you won't have to worry about getting lost in the hundreds of chats you don't frequent.

Besides, I doubt it'll be difficult to make happen. Would be great to see it happen in the coming updates. 

I'm sure user friendliness is something you guys value.

Keep up the good work!

author: Seyss
title: Missing tons of features!!
content:
- No self-destruct messages.
- Can't save more than 5 photos/videos at once to Camera Roll.
- Can't disable group/voice read receipts.
- App freezes/stutters while downloading lots of media.
- Video being played is interrupted once a background download finishes. VERY ANNOYING!!
- Even after clearing up all chats, app still keeps lots of undeletable stuck data.
- Can't clear all media and keep only text chats (no granular "clear all chats").
- No iPad / Apple Watch / iMessage support.
- Can't backup only text to iCloud (no granular backup).
- Swipe for media gallery shortcut removed.
- Archived messages confusing implementation.
- No background send from other apps (have to wait for the progress bar to complete).
- Can't search inside individual chats.
- Confusing "all starred chats" UI inside settings: make it like a regular group so we can have all the group features (mass share/save/select-all, etc).
- If you move your finger while voice recording, you can lose all you already recorded, which is terrible for long messages.
- No option to demote admins if you are the group creator.
- Messages that failed to be downloaded have to be redownloaded one by one (Whatsapp should automatically retry downloading all failed messages until they are downloaded).
- Non-admins can change group icon/name.
- Web interface and Desktop app depends on phone connection/battery to work (no direct access to Whatsapp's servers).
- While viewing all media, can't filter for video/photo/audio.
- Can't make regular calls from Whatsapp itself.
- No drafts like Telegram.
- No music player.
- No native Live Photos support (stupidly converts it to a gif instead).
- Photos taken inside the app are not Live Photos. 
- Clumsy and slow camera UI that crops your photo.

I use it all the time with my friends, family, or whoever I need to be in contact with. It's a very reliable app. It has never crashed on me or done anything of the sort. I am very content with the quality of the programming, thoughtfulness, and overall impression the app gives. This is definitely one of my more frequently used apps and I have never had a problem with it. If you want a reliable, attractive-looking, fast app for messaging, look no further. This is your answer.

446Ol9IF

author: BrandonBabb
title: Why all the hate?
content:
As a web developer I'm not sure why anyone would rate this app 1 star.

- Design and function are both top notch.
- Encryption and security.
- Desktop app.
- Smart wifi-only features.
- This app saves its users so much money from stingy cellular companies especially in third world countries (saving ten cents USD per text message!!)

The only reason to down vote is that it's hard to search a conversation for that one message, but it's my fault for not staring the message!

When whatsapp implemented Signal encryption, it became great. E2E encryption for text and calls, voice messages, groups... 

The only problem I see is that Facebook is not a trustworthy company. Watch out for cloud backup (your chats won't be encrypted) and you'll never know if the company won't jew you out since it's not open source. 

If you want proper privacy, use Signal instead.

CEO of whatsapp said it would NEVER give data to Facebook. Guess what...

author: Seyss
title: Missing tons of features!!
content:
- No self-destruct messages.
- Can't save more than 5 photos/videos at once to Camera Roll.
- Can't disable group/voice read receipts.
- App freezes/stutters while downloading lots of media.
- Video being played is interrupted once a background download finishes. VERY ANNOYING!!
- Even after clearing up all chats, app still keeps lots of undeletable stuck data.
- Can't clear all media and keep only text chats (no granular "clear all chats").
- No iPad / Apple Watch support.
- Can't backup only text to iCloud (no granular backup).
- Swipe for media gallery shortcut removed.
- Hard to view group/contact info or media gallery while "connecting".
- Archived messages confusing implementation.
- No background send from other apps (have to wait for the progress bar to complete).
- Can't "send" messages if not connected / while in low connectivity areas. Make a send queue.
- Can't search inside individual chats.
- Confusing "all starred chats" UI inside settings: make it like a regular group so we can have all the group features (mass share/save/select-all, etc).
- If you move your finger while voice recording, you can lose all you already recorded, which is terrible for long messages.
- No option to demote admins if you are the group creator.
- Favorites tab should be populated by the user or removed. 
- Contacts tab should show only Whatsapp contacts or them on top.
- Messages that failed to be sent/downloaded have to be resent/redownloaded one by one (Whatsapp should automatically retry sending/downloading all failed messages until they are finished).
- Non-admins can change group icon/name.
- Can't view all media in web interface.
- Web interface and Desktop app depends on phone connection/battery to work (no direct access to Whatsapp's servers).
- While viewing all media, can't filter for video/photo/audio.
- Can't make regular calls from Whatsapp itself.
- No stickers.
- No drafts like Telegram.
- No music player.

title: Used to be the best app... Wrong move with this silly update...

The fact that you don't even give us the choice to choose whether to update is just wrong! I don't use snapchat, neither have I used Instagram stories for a reason. Now to force those features upon is just wrong! 
Please sort this is out. Don't destroy the very thing that made this app very popular just because of the need to be like snapchat. Wrong move! Time to go back to Telegram.

author: Exonexo
title: Security
content:
For an app that makes a big deal of encryption and security. I was surprised to see that it doesn't have a lock to enter the actual app. 
What good is the end to end encryption if your phone can be unlocked by police requiring you to open your phone with your fingerprints? Your significant other gently grabbing your hand while you sleep and unlocking your phone? 
Just criticizing for a "friend". 
Other than that, pretty good app.

Someone in the reviews said it ran their phone dead , obviously that person doesn't understand how to use their device in the first place. Learn what you're doing before you blame it on something that isn't even the reason.

author: Justin McLean
title: P E R F E C T I O N.
content: First off, rating less that at least 4 stars??? Come on... go home and try another app then be disappointed. Foolish. Anyways... my girlfriend is in London for school, I'm in the states... we thought contact would be expensive maybe even impossible  but nope! <3 thanks to the dedicated team who created this brilliant app. South Africa, Australia, London... clear FaceTime with clear vocals. Saved me a fortune. THANK YOU!!! 5 stars doesn't cut it. Recommended for anyone who travels.

author: MadIronHatter
title: Great!
content: WhatsApp is great for messaging and I don't usually have any problems with it. Though, for the past couple of months something strange (not really) started happening with this app. When I'm connected to WiFi and the connection is working perfect... the app cannot connect to this WiFi and it says that there is no internet connection. This inability to connect may last for 1 or 2 days. I've been trying to deleting/reinstalling the app, turning off/on my WiFi and restarting my phone... nothing works! I have to wait for some time before it starts to work properly again itself. Other than this glitch (that I hope someone would get rid off ) everything is great and the app is really useful and easy to use.

title: Weak compared to Android

A redesign would be nice too. It's so white on this version while Android has a good tone of Green nicely spread throughout. Still a good job done on the app.

Edit: Message preview works perfect when the phone is locked, however when the phone is unlocked, the message should be displayed on the push notification, even if message preview is enabled.

author: Anonymous User 23579
title: OK but not the best
content: Whatsapp used to be one of the best messaging apps, but has since been surpassed by others. For example, Wire has more features than whatsapp, including encrypted video calling, GIFs, recalling messages, and expiring messages.  Wire also respects your privacy (doesn't require a phone number or access to all of your contacts data) and is now 100% open source.  Wire has all the other features too like group texting, voice calling, voice and video messaging, and more, all encrypted, all the time, all free with no ads. Whatsapp has recently changed their terms of service to allow whatsapp to share your phone number with their parent company, Facebook, presumably for marketing and advertising purposes.  Wire is not only ad-free, but they don't create profiles of data on their users and will never share your personal information with third parties. If you like whatsapp, then you'll love Wire.

author: Seyss
title: Missing tons of features!!
content:
- No self-destruct messages.
- Can't save more than 5 photos/videos at once to Camera Roll.
- Can't disable group/voice read receipts.
- App freezes/stutters while downloading lots of media.
- Video being played is interrupted once a background download finishes. VERY ANNOYING!!
- Even after clearing up all chats, app still keeps lots of undeletable stuck data.
- Can't clear all media and keep only text chats (no granular "clear all chats").
- No iPad / Apple Watch / iMessage support.
- Can't backup only text to iCloud (no granular backup).
- Swipe for media gallery shortcut removed.
- Archived messages confusing implementation.
- No background send from other apps (have to wait for the progress bar to complete).
- Can't search inside individual chats.
- Confusing "all starred chats" UI inside settings: make it like a regular group so we can have all the group features (mass share/save/select-all, etc).
- If you move your finger while voice recording, you can lose all you already recorded, which is terrible for long messages.
- No option to demote admins if you are the group creator.
- Favorites tab should be populated by the user or removed. 
- Contacts tab should show only Whatsapp contacts or them on top.
- Messages that failed to be downloaded have to be redownloaded one by one (Whatsapp should automatically retry downloading all failed messages until they are downloaded).
- Non-admins can change group icon/name.
- Can't view all media in web interface.
- Web interface and Desktop app depends on phone connection/battery to work (no direct access to Whatsapp's servers).
- While viewing all media, can't filter for video/photo/audio.
- Can't make regular calls from Whatsapp itself.
- No drafts like Telegram.
- No music player.
- No native Live Photos support (stupidly converts it to a gif instead).
- Photos taken inside the app are not Live Photos. 
- Clumsy and slow camera UI that crops your photo.

author: Tomisgood
title: Great App
content:
Hi, I blv space getting full due to media coming in Whatsapp msgs is a common issue now. 

Can we come up with a feature wherein, all incoming media in all the chats gets redirected to an email? Or some free space online (in the cloud)?

I don't get the time to check all my whatsapp messages and I don't want to miss them too. 

So, if they can be re-routed to my email without downloading on my phone, that would help a lot!! üòäüëç

That will help a lot üòä

WhatsApp is a Good App - if you don't have a texting app at all üòÄ

WhatsApp is the Better App - if you have a texting app üòÄüòÉ

WhatsApp is The Best App - if you have more than one texting apps üòÄüòÉüòÑ

One new feature that can be added is an option to auto-delete old media files - 
Like images / videos that are older than 5 / 10 / 15 / 30 days. 

This would help save a lot of space üòä

Also a webpage that shows the positive / good features of WhatsApp vis-a-vis other such apps would be good. 

Thanks and keep up the good work !!!  üëã‚úãüëãüòä

author: Seyss
title: Missing tons of features!
content:
- No self-destruct messages.
- Can't save more than 5 photos/videos at once to Camera Roll.
- Can't disable group/voice read receipts.
- App freezes/stutters while downloading lots of media.
- Video being played is interrupted once a background download finishes. VERY ANNOYING!!
- Even after clearing up all chats, app still keeps lots of undeletable stuck data.
- Can't clear all media and keep only text chats (no granular "clear all chats").
- No iPad / Apple Watch / iMessage support.
- Can't backup only text to iCloud (no granular backup).
- Swipe for media gallery shortcut removed.
- Archived messages confusing implementation.
- No background send from other apps (have to wait for the progress bar to complete).
- Can't search inside individual chats.
- Confusing "all starred chats" UI inside settings: make it like a regular group so we can have all the group features (mass share/save/select-all, etc).
- If you move your finger while voice recording, you can lose all you already recorded, which is terrible for long messages.
- No option to demote admins if you are the group creator.
- Messages that failed to be downloaded have to be redownloaded one by one (Whatsapp should automatically retry downloading all failed messages until they are downloaded).
- Non-admins can change group icon/name.
- Web interface and Desktop app depends on phone connection/battery to work (no direct access to Whatsapp's servers).
- While viewing all media, can't filter for video/photo/audio.
- Can't make regular calls from Whatsapp itself.
- No drafts like Telegram.
- No music player.
- No native Live Photos support (stupidly converts it to a gif instead).
- Photos taken inside the app are not Live Photos. 
- Clumsy and slow camera UI that crops your photo.

author: Tomisgood
title: Great App
content:
Hi, I blv space getting full due to media coming in Whatsapp msgs is a common issue now. 

Can we come up with a feature wherein, all incoming media in all the chats gets redirected to an email? Or some free space online (in the cloud)?

That will help a lot üòä

WhatsApp is a Good App - if you don't have a texting app at all üòÄ

WhatsApp is the Better App - if you have a texting app üòÄüòÉ

WhatsApp is The Best App - if you have more than one texting apps üòÄüòÉüòÑ

One new feature that can be added is an option to auto-delete old media files - 
Like images / videos that are older than 5 / 10 / 15 / 30 days. 

This would help save a lot of space üòä

Also a webpage that shows the positive / good features of WhatsApp vis-a-vis other such apps would be good. 

Thanks and keep up the good work !!!  üëã‚úãüëãüòä

author: Scient5000
title: Decent but not excellent... but has potential....
content:
Need the following:

- Touch ID support (must-have feature)...

- send and receive "Apple Live Photos" without losing the format i.e., without flattening the photos at the time of sending...just figure out a way to do it Whatsapp dev team...

- send more than 10 images at once...

- schedule messages to send at a later date....this will be very handy and make us more thoughtful and efficient. 

- a feature that will let the senders to delete the sent images at the recipient's end... more like what Viber is offering now. That is a cool feature.

- send volatile messages and images i.e. images that will self-destruct after a few seconds. More like snapchat... that would be awesome...

-Need a feature that will delay sending the messages by 30 sec...more like Gmail.. That will make users more thoughtful and responsible in what they have to communicate...also, will give a second chance to frantic users to undo their messages from sending....this would be a great feature...

- an outbox like feature that would allow users to queue the messages, when sending multiple messages to multiple recipients at a given time. Right now, this is not possible in WhatsApp. This feature when incorporated will appeal to a lot of travelers and people on transit wanting to send messages with limited time and network connectivity. 

- better calling features- improved call quality with better sound amplification.....also, the current voice mail feature from the last update is not that great..it is in fact silly if I may say. need a more straightforward approach  we are used to with a regular cell or landline phone....

- group calling feature...must-have feature...

- option to use multiple WhatsApp accounts (at least for two phone numbers) in one device... in that way, one can use WhatsApp for both personal and professional communications, mutually exclusively...

author: Seyss
title: Missing tons of features!!
content:
- No self-destruct messages.
- Can't save more than 5 photos/videos at once to Camera Roll.
- Can't disable group/voice read receipts.
- App freezes/stutters while downloading lots of media.
- Video being played is interrupted once a background download finishes. VERY ANNOYING!!
- Even after clearing up all chats, app still keeps lots of undeletable stuck data.
- Can't clear all media and keep only text chats (no granular "clear all chats").
- No iPad / Apple Watch support.
- Can't backup only text to iCloud (no granular backup).
- Swipe for media gallery shortcut removed.
- Hard to view group/contact info or media gallery while "connecting".
- Archived messages confusing implementation.
- No background send from other apps (have to wait for the progress bar to complete).
- Can't "send" messages if not connected / while in low connectivity areas. Make a send queue.
- Can't search inside individual chats.
- Confusing "all starred chats" UI inside settings: make it like a regular group so we can have all the group features (mass share/save/select-all, etc).
- If you move your finger while voice recording, you can lose all you already recorded, which is terrible for long messages.
- No option to demote admins if you are the group creator.
- Favorites tab should be populated by the user or removed. 
- Contacts tab should show only Whatsapp contacts or them on top.
- Messages that failed to be sent/downloaded have to be resent/redownloaded one by one (Whatsapp should automatically retry sending/downloading all failed messages until they are finished).
- Non-admins can change group icon/name.
- Can't view all media in web interface.
- Web interface and Desktop app depends on phone connection/battery to work (no direct access to Whatsapp's servers).
- While viewing all media, can't filter for video/photo/audio.
- Can't make regular calls from Whatsapp itself.
- No drafts like Telegram.
- No music player.
- No native Live Photos support (stupidly converts it to a gif instead).
- Photos taken inside the app are not Live Photos. 
- Clumsy and slow camera UI that crops your photo.
- Call drops when you lock the phone.

author: Anonymous User 23579
title: OK but there's something better
content:
Whatsapp is a pretty good messaging app, especially since they added end to end encryption to make communications private. However, Whatsapp is not 100% open source, so there is no way for programmers to independently verify that Whatsapp doesn't in fact have some type of backdoor or bypass that makes it possible for the Whatsapp company or others to record or log communications. Also, Whatsapp has changed their terms of service to allow them to share your phone number with their parent company, Facebook, presumably for marketing purposes. Finally, whatsapp still requires registration with a phone number and access to all of your iPhone contacts information.

I've since switched to Wire Private Messenger. It free, no ads, and has more features than WhatsApp. It is 100% open source so you know there are people out there checking the code to ensure no spying is possible. Also, Wire does not require access to your iPhone contacts info (it's optional) and you can register with a phone number or email address (go to their website, select "open in web" and wait a bit).  Wire's terms of service does not log your communications, does not profile you, and does not share or sell any of your information. I've since gotten some friends to try it and they prefer it over WhatsApp.

author: Anonymous User 23579
title: OK but not the best
content: Whatsapp used to be one of the best messaging apps, but has since been surpassed by others. For example, Wire has more features than whatsapp, including encrypted video calling, and better privacy too (doesn't require access to all of your contacts data).  Wire has all the other features too like group texting, voice calling, GIFs and much more, all encrypted, all the time, all free. Whatsapp has recently changed their terms of service to allow whatsapp to share your phone number with their parent company, Facebook, presumably for marketing and advertising purposes.  Wire is not only ad-free, but they will never share your personal information with third parties. If you like whatsapp, then you'll love Wire.

author: Acornbringer
title: Doing an alright job!
content:
I got this app to stay connected with my girlfriends family while in brazil. When i got my new phone number, i set up the app to find the former number owners info still in the account. It was kind of funny but i got the impression the dude ditched this number because of the spam he was getting on this app.

I still occasionally get random people messaging me and i wish there was a clear way to refuse people from messaging me unless they are contacts or something.

Other than that, it works well and its easy to use. Its not extremely pretty or anything but its not ugly by any means. Im happy with all the chat wallpapers that are included by default and most of the icons are clean looking.

I'm not sure what the deal is but the app will save images from chat to my camera roll. Ill just be deleting them until i find a way to stop that but until then it will remain an annoyance.

In general its a well rounded and well featured messaging app with good visuals but some quirks that i would like solutions for.

author: Anonymous User 23579
title: OK but there's something better
content:
Whatsapp is a pretty good messaging app, especially since they added end to end encryption to make communications private. However, Whatsapp is not 100% open source, so there is no way for programmers to independently verify that Whatsapp doesn't in fact have some type of backdoor or bypass that makes it possible for the Whatsapp company or others to record or log communications. Also, Whatsapp has changed their terms of service to allow them to share your phone number with their parent company, Facebook, presumably for marketing purposes. Finally, whatsapp still requires registration with a phone number and access to all of your iPhone contacts information.

I've since switched to Wire Private Messenger. It free, no ads, and has more features than WhatsApp. It is 100% open source so you know there are people out there checking the code to ensure no spying is possible. Also, Wire does not require access to your iPhone contacts info (it's optional) and you can register with a phone number or email address (go to their website, select "open in web" and wait a bit).  Wire's terms of service does not log your communications, does not profile you, and does not share or sell any of your information. I've since gotten some friends to try it and they prefer it over WhatsApp.

author: Alan Krishnan
title: Mr.
content:
Ability to forward messages to multiple people now is a great new feature. 

My phone was reset due to software failure. I lost all WhatsApp content. When I restored my account there was no content. It may be an opportunity to save content on server for a fee that has to be managed online and never syncs with phone. So receive on server, download to phone but retain on server. Say 2 GB free on server with FIFO - first I first out, meaning when storage gets to be 1.9 GB oldest 500 MB is deleted and this continues. Until subscriber buys space -25 GB increments - for annual fee. Software to automatically store videos in a folder, pictures in a folder and text in third folder. This can be premium service. Can offer 10 gB for $1 a month. 25GB for $2 a month and so on. Discount annual payment. 

Call me if you want more ideas. 
(703)463-9469

author: Ghayoor Arshad
title: WhatsApp is almost perfect on the iPhone
content:
I absolutely love WhatsApp. I prefer it to other messaging apps such as groupme, but it's still missing a few things in my eyes. For one, liking messages needs to happen. Perhaps maybe something similar to iMessage's Tapbacks. Also, I would absolutely love if the iOS version of WhatsApp more closely resembled the android version. The android version is much more clean and simple. It's dark green banner, and simple paginated view is much more visually appealing. Also, let's get that larger green arrow button too. 
In fact, just a straight up carbon copy would be better than the button tabs and stark white we have right now on iOS

""note that the What's app website keeps on broken on the iPhone when I connected every time the iPhone turns the screen off or logout almost immediately even know that I have the background refresh and the notifications set on""
(Please fix this issues as soon as possible and consider reading the rest of my suggestions)

((why))

why can't you clear The (broadcast list) chat from out side.

why can't you Send a forward message for multiple people. 

why can't you forward more than 10 massages. 

why can't you Share (gif) photos actually why the app doesn't play (gif) photos on the iPhone.

author: Not impressed hate it
title: Hate it
content:
The new update for WhatsApp. I have to say, I do not like it!!! I alongside many many many people prefer the previous version! And stick to the originality. It's becoming more and more like Snapchat! Let's leave these similar features alone and leave hem to Snapchat. What was once a unique app is not anymore. Please revert to the previous version!! Please and thanks.
I do not want to see status updates or status on the side like how it is now. It's retarded. If you want to change WhatsApp aleast let users change color variations in writing etc on WhatsApp and other effect instead of being similar like your competitors. WhatsApp is losing its originality!! I don't care for 24hr status updates 

Revert back to the previous version!!!

I can't see my contacts. I have to type in names to find someone to hat to. Who wants to type in a contact name allllll the time! What if a name is stored as a nickname and for some reason one might forget what their contact is under... bring back the chat option! Take away the status!!!!! 

I was able to just scroll down my chat option and look for someone to talk to... easily... now... I can't. I have to type in a name... 

I don't want to see people's statuses every two seconds. 
WhatsApp is losing its originality!! Revert to the previous version!!

It would be better to add marquee effects or any other effects to see on WhatsApp. Personalize it to ones own taste!!

Please please please revert to the previous version or update WhatsApp again and take the new "status" feature AWAYYY!!!!

author: Jomamaiswho
title: Excellent phone app.
content:
I really like this app. No longer do I waste $ on international phone calls! Great way to communicate with friends for free. All you need is internet access and your golden.
I speak with my pals in Africa all the time, haven't had any real issues with it. Not sure what all the negative fuss is about from other reviews?! It's free and very straight forward to use - allows user to make phone calls, text message, send & receive pictures AND video clips. So what if it drops out once in awhile? Seriously, what more do ppl expect for nothing? 
Yes, I would recommend this App.

author: GBZA
title: Not so great anymore
content:
I decide to rate this app just two stars after several updates and I couldn't see improvement on the following issues :

1. Typos couldn't be corrected, message couldn't be recalled or deleted after sent unlike many other apps out there. The lack of this feature has caused me several embarrassments.

2. Also when typing long messages, as soon as you move to the second line, the first line disappeared from view, you don't get to see all the message until you are on the third line or more, so inconvenient if you would want to review message before sending, more so since errors could not be corrected.

There is no denying that the app has some great new features, like text bold, status updates etc, but in my review it rates far below other apps based on the two snags listed above.
I will be willing update my review whenever these snags are corrected.

author: Nicksalter
title: Why spoil it?
content:
I never leave reviews because I don't use too many apps. But I'm forced to do so today:
Whatsapp has been for years the most reliable, simple, fast messaging app in the world.

Today, I had it severely bug for the first time ever. Messages would not send to my contacts and all the while the app was telling me they had been sent. This happened with 4 conversations.

Lastly, please, please don't turn this app into a bloated mess of hybrid messenger with media as your Messenger Facebook app is. Many of us despise that app because it is overtly decorated, and has too many features you just don't use.

Please keep whatsapp simple and take the camera Snapchat thing away.
I'm not being a reactionary, I appreciate media featured in new apps, but your answer to the competition shouldn't be to prostitute our beloved whatsapp into a mutant Snapchat/Facebook/instagram messenger app, thank you.

Takes at least 2 seconds for the menu to come on long press for message or media on a chat.  Very very slow on iPhone 6 running iOS 10.  It's like they have forgotten what scalability looks like. author: craphtis
title: Developers forgot the purpose of this app
content:
Update 2.17.20 - still no dedicated contacts or favorites tab. Absolutely ridiculous to not offer these on a calling and texting app. Facebook is destroying WhatsApp since purchasing it.

This app is a messaging service. It has been failing at providing that service for the past few months. Now it is trying to compete with social networking apps like Snapchat and Instagram. I can go use those apps for their intended purposes. I don't need WhatsApp to perform in those ways. I need to it be the quickest and easiest calling/texting service it used to be. If the favorites tab and contacts tab are brought back, then WhatsApp will be worthy of more than 1 star.

author: Edromona
title: Farewell message
content:
My dearest WhatsApp:

It's been a long time since we've met and I can't deny we've spent a wonderful time together. However, I saw you've changed drastically and that concerns me so much. I tried to understand you but never received any explanation about.

Now I think it's the right time to give a small twist to our lives... but now separately. As Cher's song says: "I found someone to take away the heartache", it's the just I can't stand your constant changes and the cat that you totally lost your focus point and don't step up to the plate anymore.

Baby, at first you were authentic: you were yourself and everybody else could've wanted to be like you, but now you're pretending to be like someone else. It's disappointing that now you're only a wannabe, and I know it's difficult to ask you to be the same as before, so I don't have more options except to say... Goodbye!

P.S. If someday you feel lost, ask Telegram (my new love) for some advices that I bet will work for you.

author: Tatsattack
title: Suggestion
content:
Hi, this is a suggestion I would like to offer...
Is there any way you guys can make the voicenotes so that you can preview them before sending? as opposed to now when you just release and they're sent automatically. 
Sometimes you talk for a long period of time and realized you could've condensed what you were saying and if you're lucky and swipe left the voicenote is deleted and you can record a new one but sometimes you just accidentally release your finger and it's too late, now it's already sent...
Other times (I know a lot of people get mixed up when chatting simultaneously with different persons or groups), and a voicenote ends up in the wrong place, so I'm absolutely sure everyone will appreciate if you offer that feature. 
Anyhow I truly hope you would consider to include this idea in a future update, Thanks!

author: ExTravel Agent
title: ‚ù§Ô∏è it
content:
At first we didn't understand why all our friends & relatives living in other countries wanted us to use this App, instead of regular texting, email or social media.  But now that we've been traveling internationally, and are in contact more often with folks outside the US, nothing beats it for ease of use. No messing with entering country & city coded more than once, and the phone call feature is great.

My only suggestion is make the ringer louder. For some reason it's way lower on my iPhone than for domestic calls

author: Jstelar
title: Jewckerberg
content:
When whatsapp implemented Signal encryption, it became great. E2E encryption for text and calls, voice messages, groups... 

The only problem I see is that Facebook is not a trustworthy company. Watch out for cloud backup (your chats won't be encrypted) and you'll never know if the company won't jew you out since it's not open source. 

If you want proper privacy, use Signal instead.

CEO of whatsapp said it would NEVER give data to Facebook. Guess what...

author: Seyss
title: Missing tons of features!!
content:
- No self-destruct messages.
- Can't save more than 5 photos/videos at once to Camera Roll.
- Can't disable group/voice read receipts.
- App freezes/stutters while downloading lots of media.
- Video being played is interrupted once a background download finishes. VERY ANNOYING!!
- Even after clearing up all chats, app still keeps lots of undeletable stuck data.
- Can't clear all media and keep only text chats (no granular "clear all chats").
- No iPad / Apple Watch support.
- Can't backup only text to iCloud (no granular backup).
- Swipe for media gallery shortcut removed.
- Hard to view group/contact info or media gallery while "connecting".
- Archived messages confusing implementation.
- No background send from other apps (have to wait for the progress bar to complete).
- Can't "send" messages if not connected / while in low connectivity areas. Make a send queue.
- Can't search inside individual chats.
- Confusing "all starred chats" UI inside settings: make it like a regular group so we can have all the group features (mass share/save/select-all, etc).
- If you move your finger while voice recording, you can lose all you already recorded, which is terrible for long messages.
- No option to demote admins if you are the group creator.
- Favorites tab should be populated by the user or removed. 
- Contacts tab should show only Whatsapp contacts or them on top.
- Messages that failed to be sent/downloaded have to be resent/redownloaded one by one (Whatsapp should automatically retry sending/downloading all failed messages until they are finished).
- Non-admins can change group icon/name.
- Can't view all media in web interface.
- Web interface and Desktop app depends on phone connection/battery to work (no direct access to Whatsapp's servers).
- While viewing all media, can't filter for video/photo/audio.
- Can't make regular calls from Whatsapp itself.
- No stickers.
- No drafts like Telegram.
- No music player.
- No native Live Photos support (stupidly converts it to a gif instead).
- Photos taken inside the app are not Live Photos. 
- Clumsy and slow camera UI that crops your photo.
- Call drops when you lock the phone.

author: _Ataraxia_
title: Needs more refinement.
content:
Number one asset is the broad user base. The other benefits are ease of use plus messaging features and organization though it lacks in areas that need to be addressed. 

1. Ability to stick to one number or email address in particularly those who travel internationally. 

2. Ability to quick comment on things said with a like or thumbs up or a smile that sticks with the message written. 

3. Often finding a constant connection is difficult preventing one to message. 

4. Image and video quality sent and received is poor. 

5. Voice quality is sub par. 

6. Should be supported on iPads. 

7. Snooping eyes of Facebook needs to be dissolved.

I depend almost 100% on WhatsApp to communicate with business & social relationships, with clients, family & friends worldwide - for texting & exchanging files in different platforms, audio & video calling, to exchange information & feelings. 
Thanks to WA, We are one Global Family! 
May Peace prevail now & forever by bringing closer two people at a time!

I hated when the Whats App call would instantly get disconnected if someone was calling on the phone line, but this is equally maddening. I have call waiting enabled, but please update the app so I can use it, and at the same time be informed about other people that are trying to reach me.

author: Seyss
title: Missing tons of features!!
content:
- No self-destruct messages.
- Can't save more than 5 photos/videos at once to Camera Roll.
- Can't disable group/voice read receipts.
- App freezes/stutters while downloading lots of media.
- Video being played is interrupted once a background download finishes. VERY ANNOYING!!
- Even after clearing up all chats, app still keeps lots of undeletable stuck data.
- Can't clear all media and keep only text chats (no granular "clear all chats").
- No iPad / Apple Watch / iMessage support.
- Can't backup only text to iCloud (no granular backup).
- Swipe for media gallery shortcut removed.
- Archived messages confusing implementation.
- No background send from other apps (have to wait for the progress bar to complete).
- Can't search inside individual chats.
- Confusing "all starred chats" UI inside settings: make it like a regular group so we can have all the group features (mass share/save/select-all, etc).
- If you move your finger while voice recording, you can lose all you already recorded, which is terrible for long messages.
- No option to demote admins if you are the group creator.
- Favorites tab should be populated by the user or removed. 
- Contacts tab should show only Whatsapp contacts or them on top.
- Messages that failed to be downloaded have to be redownloaded one by one (Whatsapp should automatically retry downloading all failed messages until they are downloaded).
- Non-admins can change group icon/name.
- Can't view all media in web interface.
- Web interface and Desktop app depends on phone connection/battery to work (no direct access to Whatsapp's servers).
- While viewing all media, can't filter for video/photo/audio.
- Can't make regular calls from Whatsapp itself.
- No drafts like Telegram.
- No music player.
- No native Live Photos support (stupidly converts it to a gif instead).
- Photos taken inside the app are not Live Photos. 
- Clumsy and slow camera UI that crops your photo.
- Call drops when you lock the phone.

author: MMD_Z
title: NEW STATUS MAKES WHATSAPP AWFUL
content:
Using WhatsApp since 2010. Only use if for business-related correspondence.

The WhatsApp web and call features were great features. However, the "Status" feature officially makes WhatsApp more of a social network than a messenger--not for the better.

I don't need to be inundated with useless photos of my (mostly business) contacts. Based on other recent reviews, it seems many people feel the same as I do.

I used the old status messages to let my business contacts know the days and times I was available to chat/talk. That's not even possible now.

If I want to see people's photos, I'll go on Instagram or Facebook. They've even hidden the contact list for sending messages (it's now in the "chats" window, instead of its own button on the main app screen).

I'm probably going to switch to Viber if WhatsApp doesn't modify or remove this feature.

author: Yahweh abides
title: Declined call visibility
content: WhatsApp is excellent, there's no disputing that. The only flaw uncovered is in its phone call feature. If I call someone and they decide for any variety of reasons not to take that call, WhatsApp openly declares the call "Declined," if that's how the receiver of the telephone reacted. "Unanswered" or "Missed Call" would serve a much less innocuous end to the initiator of the call. Now I have to wonder why my call is unaccepted? "Declined" opens a can of worms, draws suspicion from the caller, and betrays the privacy of the decliner.

Now every time I get a text im conditioned into thinking that i just got an update from ESPN or something... Also the chat title/name/'typing' are not centered and there is a lot of wasted space between the persons name and the phone call button at the top of the chat.

Also not a fan of the new UI the camera button looks bulky and weird and the Send button looks too big, but thats my prerogative.

FIX THE NOTIFICATION SOUND BUG

Edit: Using iPhone 7 with updated iOS 10.0.3

author: Ipresilia
title: BRING BACK THE OLD STATUS
content:
This new status thing is the worst idea ever. Failure of user experience, failure of user design. Change it back or don't let previous versions expire.

Unlike most of these people now, I had to pay to get Whatsapp - when it wasn't owned by Facebook - I am deeply disappointed and frustrated with the fact that I once had to pay and now you just don't listen to your customers. The ones that paid in the past, neither the ones that haven't spent a penny.

Get some new designers and developers, and do an overhaul of the app. First thing you should remove is that "snapchat-y" status thing and bring the old one back. And focus on stability instead of adding on to an app that most of the time doesn't even work properly.
